channel.title: Comments on: Rabbincal Council of America conference 1986 – the last reign of the pulpit rabbis
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2014/05/04/rabbincal-council-of-america-conference-1986-the-last-reign-of-the-pulpit-rabbis/#comment-10530">Shmilda</a>.
He retired to Israel. See the second group photo.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Shmilda.

He retired to Israel. See the second group photo.

item.title: By: Shmilda
item.dc:creator: Shmilda
item.description:
And yet, we still hear the same complaints today, especially regarding Rabbi/Dr. David Berger's point.
What became of Rabbi Walfish?
item.content:encoded:
And yet, we still hear the same complaints today, especially regarding Rabbi/Dr. David Berger’s point.

What became of Rabbi Walfish?

item.title: By: Daniel M
item.dc:creator: Daniel M
item.description: This gives historical context to where R'Avi Weiss was coming from with Open Orthodoxy. Where are these kinds of public liberal voices now within the RCA?
item.content:encoded: This gives historical context to where R’Avi Weiss was coming from with Open Orthodoxy. Where are these kinds of public liberal voices now within the RCA?

item.title: By: Jonathan
item.dc:creator: Jonathan
item.description: It would be interesting to trace the evolution of The RCA of 1986 to present ?
item.content:encoded: It would be interesting to trace the evolution of The RCA of 1986 to present ?

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2014/05/04/rabbincal-council-of-america-conference-1986-the-last-reign-of-the-pulpit-rabbis/#comment-10501">Gary Pickholz</a>.
Since you are new here, can you please stick to comments that elucidate the given post without posts thta have the potential to elicit from others the name calling found on other blogs? My goals are generally descriptive, to let my friends know about interesting documents. If you must use a post for the usual attacks found in blog comments then please re-post it elsewhere.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gary Pickholz.

Since you are new here, can you please stick to comments that elucidate the given post without posts thta have the potential to elicit from others the name calling found on other blogs? My goals are generally descriptive, to let my friends know about interesting documents. If you must use a post for the usual attacks found in blog comments then please re-post it elsewhere.

item.title: By: Gary Pickholz
item.dc:creator: Gary Pickholz
item.description: so very sad, in retrospect. It does, however, underscore the fact --30 years later--that the RCA is an irreparably flawed entity no longer worth saving. Simply throwing good money and effort after bad. Other institutions will emerge to replace it. Much like REITS and YU, I strongly suspect. The only calls for its support come from those with vested (and highly invested) interests in remaining in power and profit.
item.content:encoded: so very sad, in retrospect. It does, however, underscore the fact –30 years later–that the RCA is an irreparably flawed entity no longer worth saving. Simply throwing good money and effort after bad. Other institutions will emerge to replace it. Much like REITS and YU, I strongly suspect. The only calls for its support come from those with vested (and highly invested) interests in remaining in power and profit.
